title: Rome IV Diagnostic Criteria for Child Aerophagia
desc: The Rome IV Criteria for Child Aerophagia provides criteria for diagnosis of child aerophagia.

orgreference.text: Hyams J, Di lorenzo C, Forbes D, et al. Childhood functional gastrointestinal disorders: child/adolescent. Gastroenterology. 2006;130(5):1527-37.

data.evidence:
To fulfill the Rome IV Criteria for child aerophagia, patient must have the following (for ≥2 months prior):

  1. Excessive air swallowing.
  2. Abdominal distention due to intraluminal air which increases during the day.
  3. Repetitive belching and/or increased flatus.
  4. After appropriate evaluation, the symptoms cannot be fully explained by another medical condition.
